Disease Description: Seemingly unprovoked episode of homicidal or highly destructive behavior. Many episodes culminate in suicide. Some suggest that cases may derive traditional values placed on aggression and suicidal attacks on warfare.

Anxiety atributed to rejected lovers. Features include shouting, sobbing, paralysis, or loss of consciousness. Most victims are young, unmarried women. Some experience nightmares with sexual themes or episodes of temporary blindness. Attacks can continue for days or weeks and may be provoked by the sight of men or foreigners.
